moves.1. Nf3: After a heavy defeat its hard to face ones demons but if we wish to improve face them we must. So two weeks after the game has finished I finally have got round to annotating it for the Walk the walk thread.
moves.1... Nf6 2. d4 d5 3. c4 e6 4. Nc3 Be7: Having been an avid follower of the brigadecommander- stalhandske matches I expected 4.....c5 here with the Semi-Tarrasch Defence to the Queens Gambit Declined.
moves.5. Bf4 O-O 6. e3 b6:
Both 6....c5 and 6....Nbd7 seem more popular here but the move played is in keeping with stalhandske's style. A little bit non mainstream with plenty of potential for piece activity. 
Still in the opening book ECO reference D37
moves.7... Bb7 8. cxd5: Clarifying the situation with the pawn centre. 8.Bd3 may have been better.
moves.8... Nxd5: Keeping the h1/a8 diagonal open and better than 8....exd
moves.9. Nxd5: Played so that I didn't have to retreat the Bishop on f4
moves.9... Qxd5 10. a3: 10.Rxc7 Bb4 11.Nd2 Na6 doesn't give white much.
moves.10... Nd7: I'm out of my book now so my loss in only another 9 moves is particularly galling as in this position white looks to have equality at the least. Though I think my esteemed opponent would be happy with his position due to his piece activity.
moves.11. Bc4: 11.Qa4 may have been much better here and after the game I found in the GK database a game played with this move. When I played 11.Bc4 I saw the Qa4 ch and wasn't too unhappy about the Q exchange. Interestingly both the GameKnot engine and Houdini 2 give my move as imprecise going from a +0.20 to a -0.10
moves.11... Qa5+ 12. Qd2: 12.Nd2 was also possible as 12....Bxg2 13.Rg1 Bb7 14.Bh6 Bf6 and now the move I missed 15.Bxg7. Having missed this I played 12.Qd2
moves.12... Qxd2+ 13. Kxd2: 13.Nxd2 was an option and may have been preferable. I didn't play it because of 13.....Bxg2 but like the previous note Bxg2 is weak.
moves.13... c5: Thematic attacking the centre and threatening whites somewhat exposed king.
moves.14. dxc5: An error due to worrying about getting an isolated pawn. GK -0.69 Houdini2 -0.37. 14.Ke2 should have been played with a position close to equality e.g. 14.Ke2 cxd 15.Rhd1(the intermezzo I missed) Rad8 16.exd with a position close to equality.
moves.14... Nxc5 15. b4: Played to get rid of the weak pawn on b2 though again Ke2 getting the King of the exposed D-file was better.
moves.15... Ne4+ 16. Ke2 a5: Black now attacks whites now weak pawn on b4. I now wish I had left it on b2.
moves.17. bxa5: A blunder.-1.88 GK.-1.06 Houdini2. Both give 17Rhd1 as better though I still lose the pawn.
moves.17... Rxa5 18. Ne5: A blunder that loses a piece.  Though with white about to drop his remaining Q-side pawn then having to face blacks Q-side passer it probably shortened my misery.
moves.18... g5 19. Bg3 Nxg3+: Zip to four and probably my worst performance against stalhandske. Food for thought and back to the drawing board. But once again well played by my opponent.
